title: [K-12] Digital Game-Based Numeracy Enhancement Program: Customized Design for Slow Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Arithmetic Operations (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division)
context.additional_context: Necessity of adjusting game difficulty in stages according to individual cognitive pacing; parallel group activities and individual learning using digital devices (tablets/laptops)

learning_goals: Learners can improve their ability to apply basic operations (fractions, decimals, ratios) for everyday problem-solving by 30% within four weeks.
Learners can reduce error correction cycles by 50% through in-game feedback systems.
Learners can provide peer feedback on numerical problem-solving processes at over 80% accuracy through collaborative mini-games.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
